title: Textile, 19th–20th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: tied resist paterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave
creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
description: Very large silk piece (possibly a sari) with blue field surrounded by wide striped and ikat-dyed border in various shapes of red, brown, and white with a little blue. Wefts elaborately ikat-dyed to make pattern. Warps died red at either end and solidly blue for middle section. Garment made of two widths sewn together.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 19th–20th century.
19th–20th century. Medium: silk
Technique: tied resist paterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave. Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund. 1959-48-1.
